label: Folder 15: Whitelaw Letter 1
description: Letter to H.D. Todd from Robert N.S. Whitelaw dated Mar. 17, 1945, asking him to introduce Staats before the speech "Capital Investment in City Planning."

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: Merch 17, 1945  Mr. H. D. Todd  President, Charleston Rotary  Sears Roebuck and Complany  374 King Street  Charleston, S. C.  Dear Jack:  I am sorry that I will be out of town Tuesday, March 20th. The Community Service Committee has arranged a program to be given at the meeting of Rotary that day by Henry P. Staats on "Capita Investment in City planning". would you or A. W. Allison pease introduce Mr. Staats. will you mention the fact that the Civic Services Committee will present its off-street parking plan to City Council on March the 27th at the invitation of Counci.  Mr. Staats is an architect and city planner, a member of the American Institute of Architects, a member of our Civic Services Committee, and a technical adviser to us. He has worked amost fu time since January as a voutneer. He is a resident of itchfied, Connecticut, where he serves on the board of Progress, Inc., a group interested in city planning and tax studies. He was formery associated with the planning board of Santa Barbara. Mr. Staats owns a handsome home on ower Church Street and intends to spend the better part of each year in Charleston. I would ike to add that without his assistance we would not have been able to work out the off-street parking plan so quicky.   Sincerely yours,  Robert N. S.
